Package net.xuset.objectIO.markupMsg

MarkupMsg is to objectIO as red blood cells are to the circulatory system.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MsgParsable
    Interface that should be used if something parses or converts a MarkupMsg to it's raw form.
    MsgParser
    Interface that outlines the operations necessary to convert a MarkupMsg object to a raw form and back again.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AsciiMsgParser  
    MarkupMsg
    A MarkupMsg object is used to transfer data in a protocol independent way between connections.
    MsgAttribute
    Class used by MarkupMsg for attributes.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InvalidFormatException
    Exception thrown when parsing a MarkupMsg fails

Package net.xuset.objectIO.markupMsg Description

MarkupMsg is to objectIO as red blood cells are to the circulatory system. They are the messages that get sent from point A to be point B.

A lot of the time these messages get sent across an I/O stream. In this case the object itself cannot be sent over the stream. It must be broken down into a raw form like a byte array or char array. AsciiMsgParser does a good job at converting MarkupMsg objects into a stream friendly representation. AsciiMsgParser inherits the MsgParser interface, as should any object that converts a MarkupMsg to and from a raw form.
